title: 1 Rabbit-2 cage
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" xy + yz + xz - 2xyz "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive real numbers such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2 + y^2 + z^2 + 2xyz = 1 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", find the maximum value of the expression above."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If in 3 number  (2x-1),(2y-1),(2z-1) are always exists two possitive Real number.
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If (2x-1)(2y-1)\geq 0\Rightarrow 2(x+y)-4xy\leq 1\Rightarrow z(x+y)-2xyz\leq \frac{z}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And:1-z^2=2xyz+x^2+y^2\geq 2xy+2xyz=2xy(z+1)\Rightarrow xy\leq \frac{1-z}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rightarrow S\leq \frac{1-z}{2}+\frac{z}{2}=\frac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
====>0.5(THE ANSWER) 
Actually it's dirichlet in inequality"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1→∞1\rightarrow\infty1→∞
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\LARGE {x=\\frac { 1 }{ 1+\\frac { 1 }{ 1+\\frac { 1 }{ 1+\\frac { 1 }{ 1+\\cdots } } } } } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" up to three decimal."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\LARGE {x=\frac { 1 }{ 1+\frac { 1 }{ 1+\frac { 1 }{ 1+\frac { 1 }{ 1+\cdots } } } } \\
\Rightarrow x=\frac{1}{1+x}\\
\Rightarrow x+x^2=1\\
\Rightarrow x^2+x-1=0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=0.618"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-1.618"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Here "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can't be a negative number. So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x\neq -1.618"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\boxed{0.618}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1's

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that the first sum is a string of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007!+2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 1's, and the second is a string of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 1's."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can group the 1's in the first sum together into strings of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", in however fashion we like. Thus, we start from the left, taking off "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 1's at a time. This is equivalent to taking "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007!+2 \pmod{1009}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", trying to find how many digits are left at the end."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Because"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1008! = (1009-1)! \equiv -1 \pmod{1009}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"due to Wilson's theorem, and"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1008! = (1009-1) \times 1007! \equiv -1007! \pmod{1009}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it is then the case that"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007!+2 \equiv 1+2 \equiv 3 \pmod{1009}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 1's left over, our remainder is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{111}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            In case anyone didn't get the "due to Wilson's theorem" lines, it is probably easier to write"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007! = -(-1007!) \equiv -(1009-1)(1007!) \equiv -1008! \equiv -(-1) \equiv 1 \pmod{1009}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            yes this is a correct methods

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            this is exactly what I did :D

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I use the fact that if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=dq+r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0\leq r <d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{x^n-1}{x^d-1}=(x^d-1)f(x)+\frac{x^r-1}{x^d-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for some polynomial "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I also use 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{n-1} x^k =\frac{x^n-1}{x-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{1007!+1} 10^k}{\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{1008} 10^k}= \frac {10^{1007!+2}-1}{10^{1009}-1}=(10^{1009}-1) \cdot f(10) +\frac{10^r-1}{10^{1009}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It turns out that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is prime, so by Wilson's theorem, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1008!=-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007!+2=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1009"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{10^r-1}{10^{1009}-1}=\frac{10^3-1}{10^{1009}-1}=\frac{10^2+10+1}{\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{1008} 10^k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{1007!+1} 10^k=10^2+10+1=111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=0}^{1008} 10^k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
